resources:
// App Quit Smoking OK NO You must grant \"Access Storage Permission\" to backup and restore the diary and to load pictures from your sd-card. After that you should completely close the app or restart the phone. If you don\'t permit the storage access but want to use the screenshot function at a later time, you can grant the permission later. Please open then: system settings - apps - weather. In the permissions section you can grant the \"write storage permission\". //Share Great news: I stopped smoking since and I saved: cigarettes and of time. I stopped smoking My diary // Menu Settings Share Health Overview Diary Goal // Main Activity Configure in settings 0.0 € $ £ ¥ days hours minutes Stopped smoking at: Not smoked since: Saved: h // Health Activity Congratulations - you did it! Reached in: Blood pressure Blood pressure, body temperature and heart rate return to normal. (20 minutes) Carbon monoxide The smoker breath disappears. The poisonous gas carbon monoxide blocks for a smoker about 10% of the red blood cells. These cells are now available again for oxygen. (8 hours) Heart attack The risk of sudden cardiac death decreases. (1 day) Sense of smell The sense of smell and the taste buds becoming more sensitive; smelling and taste is refined. (2 days) Breathing Breathing becomes easier. (3 days) Nicotine withdrawal The physical nicotine withdrawal is made. (1 week) Capacity The entire blood circulation improves. The increased lung capacity by up to 30 \%, they can absorb more oxygen again. This increases the physical Performance. (3 months) Lung hairs By now, the fine hairs are regrow in the lungs, the smokers cough disappears. Exhaustion and shortness of breath improve progressively. (9 months) Coronary arteries The risk of diseases of the coronary vessels is reduced by half. (1 year) Heart attack The risk of heart attack drops significantly. (2 years) Stroke The risk of having a stroke or a lung cancer die, is substantially lower than earlier. Also the risk of cancers of the mouth is reduced. (5 years) Lung cancer The lung cancer risk is as high as a Non smoking. The lung has almost fully recovered, pre-cancerous cells are replaced by healthy cells. (10 years) Heart attack The risk of heart attack is barely higher than in a Non smoking. (15 years) // Diary Swipe down to load diary Backup successful Add current date Add current time Add a separator line Backup diary Restore diary Delete diary // Goal Choose from gallery Take photo Cancel Load image Rotate image Delete image Costs: Already saved: Remaining: // Settings Tabs Statistics Goal tab App Cigarettes Money Currency Date format Date Time Duration Goal Costs of your goal Next goal Overview tab Health tab Goal tab Diary tab Set number of daily smoked cigarettes, to calculate not smoked cigarettes Costs of a single cigarette. This is used to calculate the saved money since quitting. Set your preferred currency Set your preferred date format. Use it always, when you enter a date. Set date of last smoked cigarette Set time of last smoked cigarette The time you need to smoke one cigarette. This is user to calculate the saved time since quitting. Set the title of your goal. For what will you use the saved money? What are the costs of your goal? Use a integer number. Used to calculate the time when you reach your goal. If you reached your current goal, you can set here a start date for your next goal. This is necessary to calculate the new time when you reach the next goal, while keeping the right statistics from the overview tab. Do you want to use the overview tab? In this tab the main statistics are presented: the time of quitting, saved cigarettes, saved money and so on. Do you want to use the health tab? In this tab the progress of your health benefits are presented: risk oh heart attack, cancer and so on. Do you want to use the goal tab? Here you can set a personal goal. Something you want to use the saved money for. Do you want to use the diary tab? Here you can write a diary with your thoughts, problems and something like this. Perhaps it will help you. Number off daily smoked cigarettes What costs one cigarette? Use your preferred date format Use 24h format: 22:22 Time in hours: 0.2 Name of your goal Use integer number: 199 Changelog What is new? License App is licensed under the GPL3. //License Dialog Copyright © 2016 by Gaukler Faun This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses. //Changelog Dialog For more informations visit the project site on github:
https://github.com/scoute-dich/QuitSmoking

v 1.2:
• maintenance release
• Android N support

v 1.1.3:
• Japanese translation (Thanks to naofum)

v 1.1 - v 1.1.2:
• fixed toolbar layout
• added goal tab
• completed english translation

v 1.0:
• first release //String arrays Euro (€) Dollar ($) Pound (£) Yen (¥) 1 2 3 4 International (2016–06–20) German (20.06.2016) 1 2
